subject: Re: [junit] Rant: assertEquals(String, String) -- strdiff'ing is a bad idea
msgSnippet: ... JUnit 3.8.2 does not have this problem. Kent sent me a version privately some time back. I don t know whether he ever released that publicly. This version
messageBody:
mail_kb wrote:
> It is often the case that when something breaks, several
> long strings are programatically passed to assertEquals(),
> one of which is off by one character, sometimes a
> whitespace character.
>
> The code which tries to be clever and do a diff basically
> makes the error message quite useless, because it is
> impossible to tell which line caused the error, or where
> the error is.
>
> e.g.
>
> String TESTIN= { ...
> "Junit can get too clever for its own good"
> ...};
>
> String TESTOUT= { ...
> "Junit can get too clever for its own good"
> ...};
>
>
> [...]
> for (int i=0; i<TESTIN.length; i++) {
> assertEquals(TESTIN[i], TESTOUT[i]);
> }
>
> => junit.framework.ComparisonFailure: expected:<... ...> but was:<......>
>
> There's no way to see what really happened now.
> If the simple approach of just printing out the
> entire message was retained, it makes it more
> usable.
>
> Yes, I could always append the actual and expected
> strings to the message and do it that way -- but
> that's just a pointlessly unpleasant way to do it :)

JUnit 3.8.2 does not have this problem. Kent sent me a version privately
some time back. I don't know whether he ever released that publicly.
This version puts [] around the part that differs, but displays the
entire strings.

Another thing to do is use your IDE: both Eclipse and IDEA offer a
"compare strings" feature that pops up side-by-side windows and
highlights the portions that are different.

Another thing to do is compare strings less often that compare objects
more often, or compare shorter strings. Sometimes when testing is
painful, the pain is trying to teach us about our design. (I don't
believe this is your problem, but it might be, so I offer it as a
possibility. Too many people discount it.)
